title: Ticket #4931: Document PreJobPrioX and PostJobPrioX
description:
Brian and Todd had a lovely conversation on Friday about how it would be great if we could have secondary sorting keys for resource requests after JobPrio but before QDate. This would allow CMS to cluster similar jobs that were submitted in the same hour or day - making the current resource request count (a bit too large on CMS's pools) closer to the auto cluster count (comfortable size).

It is such a wonderful idea that it got implemented 4 years ago in #1992. Being that neither of us knew this existed (and I don't see any references in the manual), it's likely a little documentation would go a long way.

Notes:

  • These are all Job classad attributes that are evaluated when the tables are built.
  • The sorts are done by: PreJobPrio1, PreJobPrio2, JobPrio, PostJobPrio1, PostJobPrio2.
  • This is a topological sort function. Higher is better.
  • The valid values are INT_MIN+1 through INT_MAX on the relevant platforms.
check_ins:
2015-Mar-17 10:09   Check-in [43606]: For #4931, we're not putting all the info into the manual, so revise user manual content to identify the simple case and imply where experts should look, and place a more complete description into a wiki page. (By Karen Miller )
2015-Mar-16 13:17   Check-in [43593]: document levels of user prioritization of jobs #4931 (By Karen Miller )
